title: Dear Riot, if you are going to nerf colossus
body: Don't nerf the champions abusing colossus and then nerf colossus like what happened with Cinderhulk. Nerf Colossus and then buff the champions that should benefit from it but aren't even seeing play with it, like Sejuani.

In regards to the sheer size of the shield, which even coming from naut's lover, is sheer absurdity.
A solution albeit over complicated could be to have specific base values depending on the type of hard CC, a shield gain "time window" or give it diminishing returns (for champs who relentlessly dish out CC). 
I propose these as nautilus has already seen nerfs purely due to his top/support spotlight in the pro scene, which then granted him a ranked top/support god title (just like maokai) and I don't want to see him completely demolished across the board like you did to **maokai**. While he still works as a jungler (albeit just about any other CC tank is better apart from mao) I feel any further nerfs to his base dmg/Shield or his CC's duration's/intensities (which is basically his identity) will force him out of every position.

Assuming one or more of the above is implemented: He won't be able to clear the jungle(dmg/shield)//gank as well (CC), will lack utility compared to other supports and will be outright cringe worthy up top (But I wouldn't mind that, he is anti fun due to his early game lockdown. Just try and do it without crushing jungle naut)

For the first suggestion, which would come down to stronger cc=stronger shield:
1. Suppression/stasis  **Due to the tiny amount of users (bard, WW, skarner, malz) and generally single target usage it sits at the top of the food chain**
2. Stun/charm/fear/flee  **The final 3 are isolated cases and generally only affect one person, once in a team fight/engagement, hence why they get more oomf**
3. snare **There aren't many cases but due to Naut's blatant abuse case it's lower on the spectrum**
4. displacement spell (airborne)   **Easily the most common form of CC and the easiest to apply**
The shield strength goes from strongest to weakest in descending order, the harder the CC and the more isolated the usage.... the stronger the shield is. Pretty straight forward.
5. Any point+click CC spell grants 15% less shielding as the base amount

As for the time window. I mean the moment you damage an enemy champion, you have X seconds to get AS MUCH shield as you can before it goes on (perhaps a longer) cool-down by applying as much CC in that time frame. This could be implemented along with suggestion one, allowing SPECIFIC CC values to be tweaked for certain abuse cases (EG naut and leo both using stuns). 

Diminishing returns. I feel this is counter intuitive to the entire purpose of CoC so it's really a "we don't have a choice" option to punish reckless CC spam.
